title: Biggest mistakes that Bronze/Silver/Gold players do in "Elo Hell"
body:
Dear players, 

I'm a high Diamond player and I constantly hear from my real life friends that low ELO is impossible to pass once one is locked in it. After making a smurf and exposing myself to this "Elo Hell" I've made a conclusion to why games seem so hard, and how people can easily get out of, or avoid this "Elo Hell".

1) The first part that I want to touch on is why games in low ELO seem even harder to win than games in high Diamond sometimes. My first game in Silver 3 I noticed almost instantly that everyone is stuck in the mindset that they MUST carry the game in order to get out. With this shared philosophy, about everyone in the game is playing, in a lack of a better term, selfish. I can half-reason with why everyone feels this way, they consistently play with others who believe in the same idea or other players they deem "don't belong (boosted)". 

On the other hand, players need  to realize that this isn't Starcraft or Warcraft, where skill is determined through one vs one player abilities. This is a team game and in team games skill is much rather determined through how well players can sacrifice for the sake of the team's victory. Compatibility is key in team games, and this isn't any different for League of Legends. If you're asked or notice that your team needs a certain champion to have an edge, don't turn your back on them because "you need to carry solo only". 

2) This transitions well into the second part of my synopsis which focuses on what low ELO players should do to grind their way out of "Elo Hell". If being selfish is what keeps you locked in Bronze/Silver/Gold, then maybe being SELFLESS will be a key quality to breaking free and ranking up. This won't come easy, especially to the players who have played for many years. However, slowly try to embed characteristics of being selfless, sacrificing for the team, and getting more victories than reports. Remember, You don't need to carry every game, in fact, the best players in any sport or e-sport don't carry their teams by putting them on their backs. They do it by getting all their teammates to play the best of their abilities! 

Good Luck, and let me know if this helped or not! 

SHerv

replies.body: This advice is virtually useless because even if I become a team player there at 4 other people who think they have to solo carry even if they have no skill to do so. This results in them feeding and blaming me for doing no damage or not helping because they fed. The problem is the entire mindset of low elo players.

Simple solution: Over each game you play, add the one player in your team that you thought played best as a team player. Then duo with him. The next set of games find another person with similar traits and move from a duo to a trio. Settle at playing with a trio and if you three play well together, the game will become much easier.

Always remember that this is still a team game and that dynamic queue is an option that RIOT put in the game, so always use the lemons given to you since lemonade is just around the corner!
That's actually very good advice

As a support main working on climbing out of bronze (won B1 promos a few min ago), I fully understand the concept. However, there are some team-reliant champs I won't play if I'm not in a group. There's just too many people that lack some of the finer mechanics/skills that I don't trust random people in my ELO.
More people need to learn how to play support. Not main it, just play it enough to learn the role reasonably well.
People need to realize it's not a boring "adc's slave" job where all they do is ward.

It's strange for support mains since your position requires you to only team play, but carries need to learn to team play as well. Once the ADC can rely on the support and the support can rely on the ADC, that mutual trust will guarantee better gameplay. Getting their is a long road of sacrifices starting with sacrificing individual interests/plays.

you say you dont trust your teamates


change that mindset :) I rose like a rocket out of bronze by playing support. if one teamate doesn't seem to be super strong, NBD make roam plays to the teamate that is doing well. or use vision control to ensure numbers advantage on any fight. 

and most importantly. when rising, you lose about 45% of your games. so if you lose a game, just remember it's statistics that lost, learn from your mistakes when you can notice them and just be patient for that next win.

I WANT to trust them, and generally give them the benefit of the doubt once in-game. However, I will still pick champs where I can choose to carry. Not just because of that, but I have just generally done well on them.
Better safe than sorry.
Hope 45% isn't true, just won 5 in a row to qualify for series to get out of Bronze.

The best way to do that is the following: if you get ahead in lane, build to carry. if you get behind in lane, build to support. that's what I do anyway. 

I also always trust my teamates on default. if I do something that ends up being better had I be selfish, I just tell myself, that's just going to happen sometimes. and I trust the statistics that more often than not, acting to the goals of my teamate is going to be beneficial. 

naturally there are times when being selfish is always correct. I try to observe and learn when a selfish play is good. but if I don't have experience that tells me "being selfish here will help the team win" then I default to the trusting play.

10/10 willing to flash and take a cait ult to save that 1hp veigar on my team. 

but then again.... veigar was found alone at enemy t2 on the top side of the map, while the rest of us were at dragon number 3.

then the enemy team decided to pressure baron 5v4..

weve got no mid, lucian wants to be a hero and poke,** enemy thresh hook**, enemy team dives and blows him up. support tries to save him, dies too (instantly like the bothans). just me and a buddy left, we bail, they get a baron.

^

thats elo hell.

Miscommunication is solo queue, if you see you're Lucian move up for poke (which is not the right idea), the front line has to follow up and get in front. That's what solo queue is, reacting and responding to the team's actions. The different between a low ELO game and a higher ELO game is that in a low ELO game the support would die after trying to help the adc who was caught trying to poke. However, in a higher ELO game, the support would SACRIFICE himself intently to save the ADC before he dies.

Everything comes down to team management and if everyone plays their role to win the game. HINT: Every role needs to sacrifice for another role in a certain order that would benefit the team.

its not miscommunication, its strictly ignore my pings, and throws. 

people are bad, and they refuse to talk at all, they dont ping, they ignore all pings "come on man they're so loud, I dont want to listen to that crap!, people just spam anyway, it doesn't mean anything", they are dead weight in a carry position and it destroys the chance at winning.

which is why while climbing you have to take a carry role because damage needs to be dealt and if the carry throws its GG you have to assert yourself as the dominant player in the game to outweigh those terrible decisions that other people make.

im the one pinging, im the warder, im the one organizing groupings and what to go for. and people mute me, and stay in lane at 30mins in. 

----------------------------------

the difference being when i take mid away from other people, that veigar scenario cant happen, and we have a secondary damage dealer for when the 4v5 rolls around from one team mate throwing.

it should be a 5v5 at baron, but for whatever reason **usually my adc is farming bot lane handing baron over for free** and that accounts for the majority of my losses. regardless of how i ping or what i say, i can predict the baron, ward it out, show it to them on the map, but my adc is still bot lane anyway, not even making the effort to come.
A bad call made as a team is usually better than a good call made alone.

I agree, most people ignore vital pings, and it was very obvious that people don't entirely understand carry roles in lower ELO, but beginning to think that "If only I was in a carry position" will only equate to the same problem. 

The best way to get around this is to play for the team's standards. If someone wants to split whilst baron is being taken, then let them split and slow down the baron play. It isn't the smartest move at all and I know that, but the method I'm preaching is to optimize every situation by sacrificing your own reasoning on behalf the team's will. 

That being said, you should always try to suggest/offer ideas for the team to win!

I know this comes off strange and maybe even support-esque, but the same can apply even if your playing a carry role and someone isn't doing the smartest plays.

Gold 1 last season, made a smurf this season which is currently silver 1. This post is spot-on, though the phrasing I prefer is "learn to let other people carry".

The problem is that the "I must carry" mindset when behind becomes "I need to catch up so I can carry. So I'm going to fight again and outplay and win, even though I didn't outplay or win the past 4 fights." And then they end up feeding their lane so badly that the winning matchup elsewhere who *could* have carried, no longer can.

PSA: you get LP from winning, not carrying. It's OK to win games without being the one to carry them.

I agree and disagree with you. 

I agree that everyone is trying to carry and it is a problem. 

But the other side of this is that trusting another player who may or not be a good carry is hard thing. It boils down to trust and why would a person trust another. 

Also streamers consistently show with their unrank to diamond/challenger challenges that they can do what they want and carry a game. NB3 teaches the opposite message that you do, not that i am saying you are wrong. 

By going supportive (non carry menality) you litterally have to trust a person to carry/DPS for you. You are giving your fate to a person that you can only pray that will work with you.

I'm not trying to say that one should always play supportive in both role or play-style. I'm saying that sacrificing individual play is key to getting to the next level. For example, when I was taking time in lower ELO, I see a lot of this: The jungle player gets ambushed and no one rotates to help, he dies, then gets mad at the team. If lanes did a proper rotate to help him/her, then he would be happy, the lanes that rotated would have sacrificed EXP and GOLD, even though it is arguably worth it, and the team morale is boosted ten fold.

I agree that one who is higher ELO can carry games doing anything, but that is because they are HIGHER ELO. I've streamed B5 to D1, and go their doing only carry, and also by playing team heavy. I personally found that carrying was much easier, but that is simply because I am mechanically strong, and you can't teach mechanics (it comes over time). 

The point I'm trying to get across is individual play will always hold players down from true potential. Team play will be hard to master, especially in a game where everyone is flaming, but overall, it's team-play you want to get good at since it will be more useful.

Gotta disagree....I understand where you are coming from but the skill different between teammates is so HUGE in bronze that you just cant rely on them AT ALL. 80% of the player base is in bronze-silver so you get everything from people who have literally no idea how to play and cant even use their skills correctly, to people who are decent and are above bronze in most areas but are being held back by their incompetence in one particular area.

Playing a team oriented game will just leave you frustrated as there will be 1-2 people who have 0 clue what they are doing and will constantly be out of position and feeding. You will never be able to get them to group effectively and cannot use your champ to emphasize their strengths as they have none. The only way to compensate is to get overly fed yourself so you can do enough damage to make up for their uselessness. 

It might sound awful, but that was my entire experience of bronze. I tried playing 'traditional' supports in bronze. And nomatter how hard I peeled and sacrificed myself for the team, my adc would just mess up and die immediatly after. You will get rare random games where your entire team is competent enough so you can sacrifice for the teams sake but they are impossible to predict and you cant take the chance in champ select to pick something team focused when you may end up with 2 carries that are 0/5.

Even a total change of mindset for the entire bronze division wouldnt be enough as you will still have people who are so bad that you need at least 1 superfed player who can solo carry.

I ventured to bronze 3 a few days back and I know what your talking about. However, every game I played, we won and I was not carrying at all. Team synergy can always be made no matter the league/rank. Yes, teams are more incompetent in lower ELO, but if you have the right idea (which you may very well not have), then being able to command the team could be the crucial element missing.

Also, this ties into the idea that in order to command your team, you need to prove yourself. I'm not sure why this is the case in lower ELO, but to avoid this I would recommend players to practice Jungle or Mid. Jungle controls the pace of the game and mid controls where the fights are to be located. This can help people moderate the game and play it like a chess match where you control your team's activities. 

If one does not want to switch to Jungle or Mid, and still run into the same problems I would recommend finding 2 partners and start a Trio Queue.

You don't fully understand low ELO, sorry to say.

I mean overall you are correct, as players we should be playing selflessly and for the team, but when you cannot rely on that team to do their jobs then you'll just be disappointed when placing your faith in them.

I try to play for my team, I play tanks a lot and that in and of itself means relying on your team to follow your lead or take advantage of the plays you make, if not through just you peeling for them so they can do the damage that you cannot!  But at least half of the time they simply can't, they do not have the ability necessary to keep up or take advantage.

Now I'm not saying you should abandon you teammates while you hog all the gold and glory, then they REALLY won't be able to keep up, but you should always keep yourself first in your mind if you want to win!

Like sacrificing your life so your ADC can get a double kill?  YES!  Do that, it'll help them do their job more reliably.  But giving up kills to a champion who falls off like Pantheon when you're playing someone who scales like Azir?  DON'T!  Sure he may be upset with you for not letting him snowball as hard, but you can be faaaaar more beneficial to your team if you have the gold and know how to use it.

It's a balance, between selfishness and selflessness, and I don't think the key to climbing lies in either one, it lies in the balance between them both.
Yeah, I think it's closer to the truth than OP.

I have a permabanned account myself, due to extreme toxicity and a very selfish mindset, I remember placing bronze 3 and flipping my shit and being tilted every game until I finally crawled my way to silver.

I would rage and afk, I would flame my team and trash talk the enemy team, and would be way too egotistical.

When I got permabanned I vowed never to play league again and uninstalled, after a few months I, of course, came crawling back.
This time around though I've been far less toxic and have only ever recieved a chat restriction, and I've found that I easily placed bronze 1 and now I'm silver 4 and I really didn't even notice myself ranking up, I just played and breezed through my ranks rather quickly, In only 38 games I've ranked up twice which before it would take FAR more games than that when i was being toxic and selfish.

I've been playing support more and when I play Mid (my favorite role) I gank for my team a lot more than I used to and even give up kills for people to get fed, and the feel of these games are far better than solo carrying while flaming.

Of course I still have bad games, I've afk'd and I've been toxic on this account, I wont lie (the main thing being slapped into a 4 man premade and having my lane completely ignored tilts me to all hell) but for the most part I've completely changed and I actually believe those loading screen tips that say friendly players win more.


I do miss my DJ Sona though...

TLDR; I used to be a dick, im much less dick-ish now and I'm winning more and having more fun because of it.
I was happy to read this reply and it's good to hear that not only have you treated the game differently, but the game has treated you favorably as well! Good luck.

There is a big difference and game-style from Diamond and Silver Elo. Diamond people cooperate with one another and actually understand how to play the game and the character. They ward, they seldom feed, the farm like bosses, they understand the purpose of a gank, dragon/baron are considered important and etc. The same cannot be said for Bronze/Silver. This is where you are wrong with "not everyone'' needs to carry because we do. If our carries doesn't know how to carry then what do we do? How can we win a game? In the instance our carry does know then we can simply adapt (if we're smart) our game-style but otherwise we all need to carry until we know they can. I would love to play in your division, though I'm far from being as good, they are probably far less frustrating. Feeding is the biggest issue in Bronze/silver. Our division seem to love death more than Karthus.

Turret dives can me managed as long as all members are willing to commit 100%. This means that 2-3 people can dive a full hp'd top lane player (Depending on who the champ is). When you're roaming around your jungle looking for the perfect gank, always keep in mind what the other jungler may be doing. This can present to you many options: CounterGank, Objectives, and Opposite map ganks. 

I tend to camp lanes that are losing, which in my experience has worked out most of the time. A lot of players say that you should help the winning lane, but I think it's up to you! I personally like to have equally fed members rather than 1 super fed teammate and 1 super weak teammate. 

Taking kills as a jungler is up to you. It's neither good or bad, however I tend to share kills. Good Luck!

Would you recommend avoiding dives in silver unless its a reassured 120% success as players generally take the turret dives duration to makes up their minds? Or to just evaluate and go for it?
As far as camping loosing lanes, is there a point at which you give up and prioritise elsewhere? Say it's a 4/0 irelia/darius and you're zac?

1) Always camp Darius no matter what since you don't want him steamrolling your top, and if he does, do not gank him! He is capable of 1v2. I would gank a 4-0 Irelia since her strong suit is mainly 1v1, unless your top lane gets blown up in 3 hits. 

2) Personally I like to just go for it after a quick evaluation. However, I would not suggest this because it highly risky and it does require a good mechanical teammates who cooperate well. Therefore, I would say reassure that your dive will get the kill 120% and hopefully no bad trades happen afterwards.

a) people in bronze have NO CLUE how this game works
by that I mean: trading, engaging, disengaging, poking, sieging, retreating, farming, power spikes, item build, skills of ally and enemy champions, wave control, etc.

Basically, their game knowledge is very bad. Making them take bad decisions most of the time.

b) people in silver
they start to get a grasp of what the above stuff mean. But they still lack a lot

c) people in gold

As a support main, all I can say is it truly is near impossible to climb solo que. It's sort of a punishment for those who can't/don't have the ability to que duo or team. We're at the mercy of the team's ability to function together. The sad part is that concept is MIA in low elo. I'm not really complaining, just stating facts. I've noticed that some pairing is extremely mismatched where me as a lowly S5(cuz a lose streak makes me rage), gets paired with unranked and B1. Bronze and Silvers at least should be paired within their ranks. Anyway, off to the beach! Enjoy your 4th!

You can solo carry games though, I think its the realization that you cant solo carry every game that makes people think elo hell is real. I never said that playing selfish and Carrying every game will always be a bad road to take. Some players are just that good and can get away with it. However, there is a greater chance of lower ELO players getting stuck BECAUSE of this. Team play is an easier path to take and opens the game up for more option on how to win. 

Also, the game will always lead into team play in higher ELO, it would be better to get used to playing as a team earlier then later when you hit a plateau.
